page.title: 05ECOLOGY , DYKES
page.content:
{
Much of the block is at or below high water level. No natural plot has been discovered more than 15 metres above sea level. Dykes or ditches criss cross the whole area. They carry water from the agricultural land to the estuary. They can be up to 10 metres wide, are at least 5 metres deep and run for many kilometres. One dyke runs from Suddle Wood near Keelby , Lincs. on a journey of some 7 km. The dykes become swollen after heavy rain and become a serious danger to children. Many have drowned in the dykes. Because of the variation in water rate, and depth, normal water related wild life is limited.
